gospel.text:
[[Jn 10,22]]The feast of the Dedication was taking place in Jerusalem.  It was winter.
[[Jn 10,23]]And Jesus walked about in the temple area on the Portico of Solomon.
[[Jn 10,24]]So the Jews gathered around him and said to him, "How long are you going to keep us in suspense? If you are the Messiah, tell us plainly."
[[Jn 10,25]]Jesus answered them, "I told you and you do not believe. The works I do in my Father's name testify to me.
[[Jn 10,26]]But you do not believe, because you are not among my sheep.
[[Jn 10,27]]My sheep hear my voice; I know them, and they follow me.
[[Jn 10,28]]I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish. No one can take them out of my hand.
[[Jn 10,29]]My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all, and no one can take them out of the Father's hand.
[[Jn 10,30]]The Father and I are one."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John

first_reading.text:
[[Ac 11,19]]Those who had been scattered by the persecution  that arose because of Stephen  went as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch,  preaching the word to no one but Jews.
[[Ac 11,20]]There were some Cypriots and Cyrenians among them, however, who came to Antioch and began to speak to the Greeks as well, proclaiming the Lord Jesus.
[[Ac 11,21]]The hand of the Lord was with them and a great number who believed turned to the Lord.
[[Ac 11,22]]The news about them reached the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to go to Antioch.
[[Ac 11,23]]When he arrived and saw the grace of God, he rejoiced and encouraged them all to remain faithful to the Lord in firmness of heart,
[[Ac 11,24]]for he was a good man, filled with the Holy Spirit and faith. And a large number of people was added to the Lord.
[[Ac 11,25]]Then he went to Tarsus to look for Saul,
[[Ac 11,26]]and when he had found him he brought him to Antioch. For a whole year they met with the church and taught a large number of people, and it was in Antioch that the disciples were first called Christians.
first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles

psalm.text:
[[Ps 87,1]]His foundation upon the holy mountains,
the LORD loves:
[[Ps 87,2]]the gates of Zion, 
more than any dwelling of Jacob.
[[Ps 87,3]]Glorious things are said of you, 
O city of God!

[[Ps 87,4]]I tell of Egypt and Babylon 
among those who know the LORD; 
of Philistia, Tyre, Ethiopia: 
"This man was born there."
[[Ps 87,5]]and of Zion they shall say: 
“One and all were born in her; 
and he who has established her 
is the Most High LORD.”

[[Ps 87,6]]They shall note, when the peoples are enrolled: 
"This man was born there."
[[Ps 87,7]]And all shall sing, in their festive dance: 
"My home is within you."
psalm.title: Psalms
